Storage permission is required
Camera & storage permissions are required
Camera & location permissions are required
Rinse the mixing chamber with deionised water.
Empty the test chamber and fill it with the deionised water.
Invert the lid and fit it over the inner chamber, aligning the bump on the cap and the inner chamber of the test chamber.
Some excess water will spill into the overflow space. Hold tightly as shown and throw out the excess water.

Next remove the cap and pour the deionised water into the mixing chamber. For two times dilution add one measure of deionised water and one measure of your sample. For five times dilution add four measures of deionised water and one measure of your sample.
Shake the mixing chamber so the deionised water and sample mix thoroughly. Pour the mixture into the Test Chamber. Use this mixture for your measurement.
Add reagent to the measured sample.
Add Reagent A to the measured sample.
Add 5 drops of Reagent A to the measured sample.
Add Reagent B to the solution.
Add 10 drops of Reagent B to the measured sample.
Add 5 drops of the reagent to the measured sample.
Add 10 drops of pH reagent to the measured sample.
Rinse the empty cuvette and measuring tube twice with the sample to remove any traces of previous solutions.
Measure %sampleQuantity ml of the sample with the measuring tube.
Open the vial of Reagent A.
Close the lid of the measuring tube and shake it to ensure proper mixing of the reagent and sample.
Pour the contents of the mixing tube into the provided cuvette.
Close the lid, wipe any excess water and fit the cuvette into the pipe.
Press the start button below and then place the phone face down, and use the sticker to help center the cuvette over the camera.
Accept the screen pin alert. Then place the phone face down, and use the sticker to help center the cuvette over the camera.
Have you done this, this and this? Okay now start the timer.
Empty contents of the cuvette and rinse it
Rinse the measuring tube and the test cuvette twice with distilled water to remove any traces of previous solutions.
Measure %dilutedSampleQty ml of the sample
Add %distilledQty ml of distilled water to the sample to bring the total volume up to %sampleQuantity ml
Add 1 vial of Aluminum reagent A, followed by Aluminum reagent B and then Aluminum reagent C to the measured solution.
Add one tablet each of reagent A and B into the measuring tube.
Add 1 drop of acid from the dropper bottle.
Add 1 drop of ammonia from the dropper bottle.
Add 1 spoon of Calcium Carbonate to the solution.
Add 10 drops of Calcium Chloride to the solution.
Add 1 vial each of Arsenic reagent A, B and C to the measured solution.
Close the lid of the measuring tube and shake it to ensure proper mixing.
Note: If there is iron, the solution will turn yellowish.
Fold the filter paper as shown.
Place it in the funnel as shown.
Place it in the funnel.
Take another filter paper and place it in the funnel.
Filter the solution through the filter paper, into the 10 ml measuring cylinder.
Filter approximately 100 ml of sample through the filter paper.
The filtered sample can be discarded, but keep the filter paper for the next step.
Remove the filter paper, unfold it and place it in the measuring tube.
Add 2 ml of extraction solution to the filter paper in the measuring tube.
Filter the extracted sample through the funnel, directly into the borosil cuvette.
Add 3 drops of Phosphate reagent B to the solution.
Add 5 drops of Reagent A to the measured sample.
Add half a spoon of Sulphate B to the solution.
Continue crushing of the sample util the greenish colour disappears from the filter - this could take up to 5 minutes.
Add more extraction solution until it reaches the 10 ml mark.
